testCases.description: Classic lipid-rich adenoma with high washout values (APW 75%, RPW 50%)
testCases.clinicalContext: Lipid-rich adenoma with negative unenhanced HU and rapid washout. Both APW and RPW exceed thresholds.

testCases.description: Adenoma exactly at APW threshold (APW = 60.0%, RPW < 40%)
testCases.clinicalContext: Borderline case: APW exactly at 60% threshold qualifies as adenoma.

testCases.description: Adenoma exactly at RPW threshold (APW < 60%, RPW = 40.0%)
testCases.clinicalContext: RPW exactly at 40% threshold qualifies despite APW being below threshold.

testCases.description: Adenoma exactly at both thresholds (APW = 60%, RPW = 40%)
testCases.clinicalContext: Edge case meeting exactly the RPW threshold.

testCases.description: Non-adenoma/metastasis: below both APW and RPW thresholds
testCases.clinicalContext: Characteristic of adrenal metastasis or other malignancy - fails both washout criteria.

testCases.description: Non-adenoma just below both thresholds (APW = 59.9%, RPW = 39.9%)
testCases.clinicalContext: Edge case: APW at 59.9% just below 60% threshold - does not qualify as adenoma.

testCases.description: Lipid-poor adenoma: high unenhanced HU but high APW (Caoili criteria)
testCases.clinicalContext: Lipid-poor adenoma (unenhanced >10 HU) correctly identified by washout despite elevated baseline.

testCases.description: Pheochromocytoma: high enhancement, minimal washout
testCases.clinicalContext: Pheochromocytoma typically shows avid enhancement but slow washout.

testCases.description: Adrenal metastasis: moderate enhancement, poor washout
testCases.clinicalContext: Typical metastasis pattern with retained contrast at delayed phase.

testCases.description: Adrenocortical carcinoma: heterogeneous, poor washout
testCases.clinicalContext: Primary adrenocortical carcinoma typically shows poor washout characteristics.

testCases.description: Adenoma with relatively low enhancement but adequate washout
testCases.clinicalContext: Low-enhancing adenoma with good washout. Negative unenhanced HU suggests lipid-rich.

testCases.description: Highly enhancing adenoma with excellent washout
testCases.clinicalContext: Hypervascular adenoma still shows characteristic rapid washout.

testCases.description: Adenoma with negative unenhanced HU (lipid-rich, classic)
testCases.clinicalContext: Classic lipid-rich adenoma with negative unenhanced attenuation (<10 HU). Washout confirms diagnosis.

testCases.description: Adenoma with zero unenhanced HU
testCases.clinicalContext: When unenhanced = 0, APW equals RPW mathematically.

testCases.description: Indeterminate lesion with very high baseline and marginal washout
testCases.clinicalContext: High unenhanced HU (>30) with insufficient washout - concerning for malignancy.

testCases.description: Adenoma meeting only RPW threshold (APW < 60%, RPW > 40%)
testCases.clinicalContext: Both thresholds exceeded in this case, demonstrating the OR logic in interpretation.

testCases.description: Lesion with minimal enhancement from baseline
testCases.clinicalContext: Minimal enhancement may limit accuracy of washout calculations.

testCases.description: Adenoma with exceptionally high washout (APW 90%, RPW 80%)
testCases.clinicalContext: Very high washout is highly specific for adenoma.

testCases.description: Reference case based on Caoili et al. 2000 adenoma example
testCases.clinicalContext: Based on typical adenoma values from Caoili EM et al. AJR 2000;175:1411-1415.

testCases.description: Reference case based on Caoili et al. 2000 non-adenoma example
testCases.clinicalContext: Based on typical non-adenoma values from Caoili EM et al. AJR 2000;175:1411-1415.

testCases.description: No washout: portal equals delayed (0% washout)
testCases.clinicalContext: Zero washout is highly concerning for malignancy.

testCases.description: Negative washout: delayed higher than portal (continued enhancement)
testCases.clinicalContext: Negative washout (continued enhancement) is highly atypical - may suggest pheochromocytoma or other lesion.

testCases.description: Large adenoma (>3cm): borderline washout (reduced sensitivity per literature)
testCases.clinicalContext: Large adenomas (>3cm) have reduced washout sensitivity (66.7% per Park et al. 2015). Just meets APW threshold.

testCases.description: Hypervascular metastasis (e.g., RCC): may mimic adenoma washout
testCases.clinicalContext: CAVEAT: Hypervascular metastases (RCC, HCC) may show adenoma-like washout. Clinical correlation required.

testCases.description: Mayo Clinic protocol: typical adenoma with standard timing
testCases.clinicalContext: Typical adenoma following Mayo Clinic adrenal mass characterization protocol.

absoluteWashout.description: Absolute percentage washout accounts for baseline unenhanced attenuation

relativeWashout.description: Relative percentage washout used when unenhanced images not available

protocol.roi: Placed in solid, enhancing portion of lesion avoiding necrosis and calcification

caveats: Hypervascular metastases (RCC, HCC) may show adenoma-like washout
Large adenomas (>=3cm) have reduced washout sensitivity (66.7%)
Pheochromocytomas may have variable washout characteristics
Technical factors (timing, contrast bolus) affect measurements

references.title: Adrenal Masses: Characterization with Combined Unenhanced and Delayed Enhanced CT
Evaluation of Adrenal Metastases from Renal Cell Carcinoma and Hepatocellular Carcinoma: Use of Delayed Contrast-Enhanced CT
Washout Analysis Using Delayed Contrast-Enhanced CT for Adrenal Mass: Size Matters
